Directories Nam Nguyen Professor Contact Info Phone: 410-704-3089 Office: YR-206N Email: npnguyen@towson.edu Education Ph.D., Computer Science, University of Florida Areas of Expertise Complex Network Analysis, Mobile Computing, Social Data Analysis and Data Mining Biography Nam Nguyen is currently a Professor in the Computer and Information Sciences Department. He received his PhD degree in Computer Science from the University of Florida in 2013. Prior to his PhD, he got his M.S. and B.S. from Ohio University (in 2009) and Vietnam National University (in 2007). Nguyen's research interests focus on Network Structure Analysis, BigData, Social-aware Information Mining, Cyber Security, and Practical Mobile Computing applications. Nguyen has published over 30 research papers in major conferences and journal. He has served as an Associate Editor of Springer's Computational Social Network jounal, the TPC Co-chair for CSoNet 2015 and as a TPC member for many research conferences including IEEE INFOCOM'16 and MSN'14 - 15. Nguyen is also the reviewer for IEEE Trans. on Distributed Computing (TPDS), Trans. on Networking (TON), Trans. on Service Computing, etc. In 2015, Nguyen served as a panelist for the National Foundation of Science, USA. Professional Service: Associate Editor - Computational Social Networks Journal (2013 - now). Conference TPC Member IEEE Conference on Computer Communications (INFOCOM), 2016. IEEE Conference on Mobile Ad-hoc and Sensor Networks (MSN), 2014, 2015. Journal and Conference reviewer IEEE Trans. on Distributed Computing (TPDS) IEEE Trans. on Networking (TON) IEEE Trans. on Services Computing IEEE Trans. on Vehicular Technology (IVT) IEEE Trans. on Computational Social Systems IEEE Trans. on Cybernetics Elsevier Neurocomputing Elsevier Information Sciences Theoretical Computer Sciences (TCS) Social Network Analysis and Mining (SNAM) Int. Alim, Nam P. Nguyen, My T. Thai and Abdelsalam Helal, IEEE/ACM Transactions on Mobile Computing, 2015 (Under revision). A method to detect communities with stability in social networks,Nam P.
